name: Xisal_859793_Var03_r05_d00_a01_b03
description:
Xisal combines three separate periodic formulae, mappping each one onto a dot-matrix grid with separate ranges and offsets. Noise is taken from circular motion on a 2D noise field with its own radius and offset. These values are mapped onto a range of colours according to one of seven different algorithms, and rotation is added to produce interference patterns with a choice from eight rendering modes.
The initial seed for this loop of 120 frames is 859793, which selects function 1 with offset (-8.0, -2.0), range (0.7000035, 0.39999604), and function 3 with offset (-28.0, -61.0), range (0.6, -10.500007). Noise is produced from sampling points on an ellipse at co-ordinates (88.0, 11.0) with diameters (1.6000009, 0.4000006). The three formulae are combined using algorithm 5 with hue values starting at 321 with range 305. The grid is 101 units square.
